dta.Phase¶

class Phase(timePlan, green, yellow, red, phaseType=0)¶

Bases: object

A phase consists of timing (green, yellow and red times) plus a set of PhaseMovement instances that are allowed to move during the green time.

A phase can be Standard, or Custom; the difference being that a custom phase movement can specify a subset of the movement lanes that are permitted/protected.

Right now, Custom phases aren’t really supported.

Constructor.

  • timeplan is the TimePlan instance to which this Phase belongs.
  • green, red, and yellow are numbers (int or float) representing the number of seconds for each light
__init__(timePlan, green, yellow, red, phaseType=0)¶

Constructor.

  • timeplan is the TimePlan instance to which this Phase belongs.
  • green, red, and yellow are numbers (int or float) representing the number of seconds for each light

Attributes

TYPE_CUSTOM int(x[, base]) -> integer
TYPE_STANDARD int(x[, base]) -> integer
TYPE_CUSTOM = 1¶

Custom phase, where the relevant movements have specified lanes that are permitted/protected

TYPE_STANDARD = 0¶

Standard phase

addPhaseMovement(phase_movement)¶

Add the input movement (an instance of PhaseMovement) to the phase.

If the movement already exists a DtaError will be raised.

getDynameqStr()¶

Return the Dynameq representation of the phase as a string. Includes ending newline.

getGreen()¶

Return the green time in seconds (an integer or float)

getNumPhaseMovements()¶

Return the number of phase movements in the phase

getPhaseMovement(startNodeId, endNodeId)¶

Return the PhaseMovement from startNodeId to endNodeId

getRed()¶

Return the red time in seconds (an integer or float)

getTimePlan()¶

Return the timeplan associated with this phase

getYellow()¶

Return the yellow time in seconds (an integer or float)

hasPermittedPhaseMovement(startNodeId, endNodeId)¶

Return True if the phase has a permitted movement from start node to end node

hasPhaseMovement(startNodeId, endNodeId)¶

Return True iff the phase has the phase movement with the given id

hasProtectedPhaseMovement(startNodeId, endNodeId)¶

Return True if the phase has a protected movement from input start node to end node

iterPhaseMovements()¶

Return an iterator the the PhaseMovement instances for this Phase

classmethod readFromDynameqString(net, timeplan, lineIter)¶

Parses the dynameq phase string defined in multiple lines of text and returns a Phase object.

  • lineIter is an iterator over the lines of a text file containing the Dynameq phase info.
  • net is an instance of DynameqNetwork
  • timePlan is an instance of TimePlan
